005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupMultiline;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.DynamicContext;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathException;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IDefinitionNodeItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IAttributable;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IDescribable;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.ISource;
016import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
017
018import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
019import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
020
021/**
022 * Represents a rule constraining the model of a Metaschema assembly, field or
023 * flag. Provides a common interface for all constraint definitions.
024 */
025public interface IConstraint extends IAttributable, IDescribable {
026  /**
027   * The degree to which a constraint violation is significant.
028   * <p>
029   * These values are ordered from least significant to most significant.
030   */
031  enum Level {
032    /**
033     * No violation.
034     */
035    NONE,
036    /**
037     * A violation of the constraint represents a point of interest.
038     */
039    INFORMATIONAL,
040    /**
041     * A violation of the constraint represents a fault in the content that may
042     * warrant review by a developer when performing model or tool development.
043     */
044    DEBUG,
045    /**
046     * A violation of the constraint represents a potential issue with the content.
047     */
048    WARNING,
049    /**
050     * A violation of the constraint represents a fault in the content. This may
051     * include issues around compatibility, integrity, consistency, etc.
052     */
053    ERROR,
054    /**
055     * A violation of the constraint represents a serious fault in the content that
056     * will prevent typical use of the content.
057     */
058    CRITICAL;
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * The default level to use if no level is provided.
063   */
064  @NonNull
065  Level DEFAULT_LEVEL = Level.ERROR;
066
067  /**
068   * The default target Metapath expression to use if no target is provided.
069   */
070  @NonNull
071  String DEFAULT_TARGET_METAPATH = ".";
072
073  /**
074   * Get a string that identifies the provided constraint using the most specific
075   * information available.
076   *
077   * @param constraint
078   *          the constraint to identify
079   * @return the constraint identification statement
080   */
081  @NonNull
082  static String getConstraintIdentity(@NonNull IConstraint constraint) {
083    String identity;
084    if (constraint.getId() != null) {
085      identity = String.format("with id '%s'", constraint.getId());
086    } else if (constraint.getFormalName() != null) {
087      identity = String.format("with the formal name '%s'", constraint.getFormalName());
088    } else {
089      identity = String.format("targeting '%s'", constraint.getTarget());
090    }
091    return ObjectUtils.notNull(identity);
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Retrieve the unique identifier for the constraint.
096   *
097   * @return the identifier or {@code null} if no identifier is defined
098   */
099  @Nullable
100  String getId();
101
102  /**
103   * Get information about the source of the constraint.
104   *
105   * @return the source information
106   */
107  @NonNull
108  ISource getSource();
109
110  /**
111   * The significance of a violation of this constraint.
112   *
113   * @return the level
114   */
115  @NonNull
116  Level getLevel();
117
118  /**
119   * Retrieve the Metapath expression to use to query the targets of the
120   * constraint.
121   *
122   * @return a Metapath expression
123   */
124  @NonNull
125  String getTarget();
126
127  /**
128   * Based on the provided {@code contextNodeItem}, find all nodes matching the
129   * target expression.
130   *
131   * @param item
132   *          the node item to evaluate the target expression against
133   * @param dynamicContext
134   *          the Metapath evaluation context to use
135   * @return the matching nodes as a sequence
136   * @throws MetapathException
137   *           if an error occurred during evaluation
138   * @see #getTarget()
139   */
140  @NonNull
141  ISequence<? extends IDefinitionNodeItem<?, ?>> matchTargets(
142      @NonNull IDefinitionNodeItem<?, ?> item,
143      @NonNull DynamicContext dynamicContext);
144
145  /**
146   * Retrieve the remarks associated with the constraint.
147   *
148   * @return the remarks or {@code null} if no remarks are defined
149   */
150  MarkupMultiline getRemarks();
151
152  /**
153   * Used for double dispatch supporting the visitor pattern provided by
154   * implementations of {@link IConstraintVisitor}.
155   *
156   * @param <T>
157   *          the Java type of a state object passed to the visitor
158   * @param <R>
159   *          the Java type of the result returned by the visitor methods
160   * @param visitor
161   *          the visitor implementation
162   * @param state
163   *          the state object passed to the visitor
164   * @return the visitation result
165   * @see IConstraintVisitor
166   */
167  <T, R> R accept(@NonNull IConstraintVisitor<T, R> visitor, T state);
168}
